fact_list.fact_text: Motorists are advised to look out for other parking restriction signs within the car park besides the car park signboard.
The car park signboard is located either at the entrance of each car park or along the public road.
The car park signboard indicates the different parking schemes, their operating hours, and parking rates available.
Sufficient coupons must be displayed to cover the parking period.
Tabs must be torn off completely to indicate the date and start time of parking the vehicle.
Displaying a coupon with irregularities indicating tampering is a serious offence.
Parking offences related to tampered coupons are chargeable in Court.
Parking coupons can be purchased from authorised sales outlets.
Some HDB/URA car parks use the Electronic Parking System (EPS).
With EPS, parking charges are on a per-minute basis.
For short-term parking, the EPS system reads the In-Vehicle Unit (IU) numbers of vehicles entering the car park.
Parking charges under EPS can be paid through cash card or EZ-link card.
For season parking under EPS, the system captures IU numbers of the season parking ticket holderâ€™s vehicle for identification to allow entry and exit.
For more information about parking systems, visit www.hdb.gov.sg or www.ura.gov.sg.
